Content: 7,500 kilograms of garbage tea has been seized by the Special Task Force at the Gadalaa-deniya area in Gampola along with a suspect. The STF said that the stock of tea was being transported in packages labelled under the ‘Ceylon Tea’ brand. The certification of standard of the Sri Lanka Tea Board has also been fixed on the stock. Due to garbage tea, country’s tea export industry has been hindered severely at the international level. The Davula-gala police station conducts further investigations into the incident.
